title: Craft and Structure Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Interpret words in context with precision
Analyze text structure and author’s purpose
Apply strategies to decode tough distractors

content.title: Craft and Structure
content.subtitle: Language, structure, and purpose
points: Meaning of words and phrases in context
Author’s point of view and purpose

content.title: Common Pitfalls
content.explanation: Trap answers may use a dictionary definition of a word rather than the contextual meaning, or state a plausible purpose that isn’t supported.
content.example: ‘Novel’ can mean new or literary work — only context reveals the correct sense.

content.title: 5-Step Approach
steps: Step 1: Clarify — paraphrase the sentence in your own words.
Step 2: Purpose — ask why the author included this sentence/structure.
Step 3: Predict — anticipate meaning before looking at options.
Step 4: Eliminate — cut answers that are true but not supported by passage purpose.
Step 5: Verify — reread with your choice to check coherence.

content.title: Apply the Strategy
content.question: In the passage, the phrase 'a novel approach' most nearly means:
choices: a method described in a book
content.explanation: Only 'innovative method' fits the context of scientific research. Trap B relies on dictionary meaning. Trap C contradicts 'novel'. Trap D is unrelated.

content.title: Solution Walkthrough
solution_steps: Predict: must mean new or original.
Check B: literal 'book' meaning doesn’t fit.
Check C: 'traditional' is opposite of novel.
Correct: A fits both meaning and context.

content.title: Key Takeaways
content.summary: Craft and Structure questions test how language and structure create meaning.
key_points: Always test words in passage context, not dictionary definitions.
Author’s purpose is about intent, not personal opinion.
Paired texts: look for similarities and differences in approach.
content.next_steps: Practice with dual passages to sharpen comparative analysis.
